title: Chloe Ferry stumbles as she struggles to keep her LBD over her surgically-enhanced assets

Chloe Ferry nearly showed more than she bargained for in her microscopic LBD.

But the Geordie Shore star, 24, wasn't shy about hiking up her dress to ensure she protected her modesty on her night out, in Newcastle on Tuesday.

The blonde bombshell grappled with her surgically-enhanced cleavage to stop herself from spilling out of the low-cut ensemble.

Before her hot arrival at Tiger Tiger night club, Chloe stumbled in her steep heels which stopped her in her tracks.

However, the reality star maintained her glam looks as she styled out a messy ponytail and applied heavy make-up to her features.

(Image: BLACKBURN/CROSBY / BACKGRID)

The Newcastle beauty quickly found her footing as she made a beeline for the club to join her Geordie Shore pals.

Although spotted sauntering solo, Chloe was out on the town with her co-star Amelia Lily to film scenes for the latest Geordie Shore.

No doubt it promised to be a raucous night for the pair.

(Image: BLACKBURN/CROSBY / BACKGRID)

(Image: BLACKBURN/CROSBY / BACKGRID)

In the past, the Newcastle born beauty shared she had an "addiction" to plastic surgery but she confessed it was an expensive hobby.

Chloe divulged her perfect body shape is an impossibly tiny waist with a huge bum and hips.

She told Closer magazine : "Of course, it's a bit addictive. But I can stop myself, I'm happy with myself now.

"I've spent a lot of money, it's expensive. I've worked hard for my money and I want to spend it on this.

"My ideal body shape is a small waist with a big bum and hips ... But I think people believe I've had more surgery than I have."

She also claimed she wanted to look "like a blow-up sex doll", adding: "I look like a completely different person. I feel fantastic about that – amazing."
